definition: to hear (sth said)/one hears (that)/hearsay/listening and speaking
(literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow
to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)

sentences.english: Andrew's face fell when he was told he couldn' t go on the trip.
sentences.chinese: 安德魯聽說他不能去旅遊時臉沉了下來。

sentences.english: As for whether he will visit the DPRK, I am not aware of such an arrangement.
sentences.chinese: 至於他是否去朝鮮，目前我沒有聽說有這方面的安排。

sentences.english: And I heard it helps to have funding in advance too.
sentences.chinese: 而且我聽說這也有助於提前得到資助。

sentences.english: Good ability for listening , speaking , reading and writing english.
sentences.chinese: 良好的英語聽說讀寫能力爲佳。

sentences.english: I heard that when a group of girls tried to escape, they locked them in the rooms and beat them up.
sentences.chinese: 我聽說有一羣女孩試着逃走，被他們鎖在屋子裏狠揍。

sentences.english: Upon my word, I've never heard of such a thing.
sentences.chinese: 說實在話，我從未聽說過這種事情。

sentences.english: Have you heard of rocket scientist Sun Jiadong?
sentences.chinese: 你聽說過火箭科學家孫家棟嗎？

sentences.english: You heard Dr. turtle scratch-free car wash do?
sentences.chinese: 您聽說過龜博士的免劃痕洗車嗎？

sentences.english: We have only hearsay for that.
The young author burned energy as if he never heard of resting.
sentences.chinese: 這位青年作家耗費精力，似乎從未聽說過休息。

sentences.english: We’ve all heard about the Earth’s temperature rising at an alarming rate.
sentences.chinese: 我們都聽說了地球的溫度在以令人擔憂的速度上升。

sentences.english: I have never eaten it, even heard it.
sentences.chinese: 我從來沒喫過它甚至連聽都沒聽說過。

sentences.english: In fact, we heard that kid is right here in the jungle.
sentences.chinese: 實際上，我們聽說那個孩子就正好在森林裏。

sentences.english: And I hear it gets even more complicated once they’re smoked.
sentences.chinese: 而我聽說一旦被燻烤之後情況就更復雜。

sentences.english: I'm A-Ok. I heard that you are visiting NYC next month, why?
sentences.chinese: 我還行。聽說你下個月要去紐約了，爲什麼？

sentences.english: Tracy: Oh, I've heard of it.

definition: It is said that ... (at the start of a narrative)/to discuss/to recount
only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)

that one/that thing/that (as opposed to this)/(used before a verb or adjective for emphasis)/(used to humorously or indirectly refer to sth embarrassing, funny etc, or when one can't think of the right word)/(used in speech as a filler, similar to "umm", "you know" etc)/(euph.) menstruation/sex/also pr. [nei4 ge5]
don't tell me .../could it be that...?
